title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Homewood, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Met with onboarding team and management. It was a meet and greet. They were prompt and on time. Overall it was a pleasant experience. If offered another position again I would accept.
Interview Questions: Why should we higher you? Are you available for the schedule offered to you?

title: Payroll Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It was awesome process. It was easy first the hiring manager calls and then if you make it to next cut you talk to your manager. Once you talk the manager then i had zoom call with all the team
Interview Questions: I do not remember the question

title: Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Things can move slowly but that is expected at academic centers. They are very respectful. The point of contact in the office is very nice. Communication is a mix of phone and email.
Interview Questions: They asked about career goals.

title: Section Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Long process with too many steps to secure final offer. The questions and different phases of interview were not in line with the salary level of the position. The organization asked for proprietary infromation that I was unwilling to provide for the position
Interview Questions: Provide writing sample and budget pages

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: 20 minute short phone call after applying that was mostly a screening rather than an interview. Recruiter was very nice and easy to talk to, and questions were fairly general or yes/no answers.
Interview Questions: Run me through your experience and skills.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. They were professional and easy going. It made for an easy interview. It was a great place to work. Leadership was mostly very good even though some received promotions that a lot of people didn’t agree with.
Interview Questions: My experience in Human Resources

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Harvey, IL) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received interview through a 3rd party workforce center. Was originally scheduled for a zoom interview but ghosted. Rescheduled zoom interview but was asked to leave as another person was being interviewed. Instead received a call for a phone interview with 2 people I was not familiar with a few minutes later who seemed unprepared and pretty much felt like a send off. I took the email of one of the women interviewing me to keep in touch for addtl opps since I knew they were looking for someone with more experience for a Registry position.
Interview Questions: Can you tell  us about yourself

title: Patient Appointment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied and then the HR person reach out to me 2 days later. I had an virtual interview with the department manager the next day, then 3 weeks later  the recruiter reach out to me to offer me the position. Everything went so smoothly
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in the next 5 years

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Standard 30 min Hr call then 30 min virtual onsite. Overall is a pretty standard process with BQ questions majorly.  Not that difficult. After 3 days was told the position was filled by another candidate. Not much to ask.
Interview Questions:
How do you mange time? 
 Tell me how you approach a problem using an example.

title: Full Stack Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Initial screening call. 

Take home technical assignment: create an ER diagram and an UML diagram based on a brief description of technical requirements.

Non-technical 1-on-1 with several team members (not panel).

Follow up with manager to discuss the take home assignment.

The last interview is just a half hour 1-on-1 with the director. No technical questions.

After that they call your references.

If all goes well they will call you to negotiate salary. The salary was lower than the range the recruiter gave me. The recruiter said the range was $110-120K for this position, but the initial offer was a bit lower with a sign on bonus. I was able to negotiate to $115K, which according to the HM was “the most they could do”.
Interview Questions: Create an ER diagram and an UML diagram based on a brief description of technical requirements.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: All situational questions. Even if your response was not the best in the moment how did you correct it. Don’t be to rehursed. They like you thinking over the question. You will interview w peers before manager
Interview Questions: Tell me how you noticed a way an institution could work better and how did you address the issue

title: Blood Bank Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers asked at least 12 very specific scenario-type questions that did not apply to me because this would be my first official job. Did not really ask anything to learn about my accomplishments or what makes me unique and why they should want to hire me. At the end, when I asked them some questions, they gave short and sarcastic answers. I found the interview very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work with someone that you would not normally get along with outside of the work place and how did you handle this?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter didn’t email or call me about interview date/time change. After the phone interview, I was completely ghosted and never heard anything. The least ANY recruiter/HR can do is give you an update whether positive or negative. It’s not that hard.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone screen with the HR recruiter. A few days later I interviewed with the director. He informed me I'd move forward for second round of interviews. Never heard back  from the recruiter to schedule that (I did follow up a week later with no response).
Interview Questions: What interested you about this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone screen with the HR recruiter. A few days later I interviewed with the director. He informed me I'd move forward for second round of interviews. Never heard back  from the recruiter to schedule that (I did follow up a week later with no response).
Interview Questions: What interested you about this position?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received an email a couple days after initial application. Set up a 30 -45 minute phone interview which involved explanation of open positions, as well as typical, yet involved interview questions.
Interview Questions:
Why I chose the career I entered
How I resolve difficult situations

title: Clinical Manager - Outpatient Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Practice Manager, Medical Director, Department Chair. Very informative and through interview process. I appreciated seeing the clinic space during, as well as after hours to understand space and processes that had been previously established.
Interview Questions: Walk me through a scenario in which you utilized one or more management styles to successfully manage your staff to accomplish a measurable goal.

title: Phlebotomists Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was typical interview questions . Just be honest and have confidence . Know the order of draw make eye contact ! Even if you are nervous don’t let them know
Interview Questions: What is the order of draw

title: PCR Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done appropriately due to COVID.  Every step was explained properly and was guided in the right way through the onboarding process. I was definitely impressed. At the time I was being interviewed at several company and this was different for sure.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to Uchicago

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview:
why I wanted to be a nurse
where do I see myself 3-5 years
why do I want to work with this facility
am I vaccinated
NCLEX test date
what is an expected salary
Interview Questions: why I wanted to be a nurse

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Apply through ERAS. Interview w two faculty members, lunch w residents and then head to morning report to listen to the conference. Overall, its very relaxed and comforting. Its a great interview day
Interview Questions: What questions do you have for me?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter will contact you first for an interview then will schedule an interview with the managers of the unit. The recruiter interview was a phone interview but the managers interview was via Zoom.
Interview Questions: How are you with working under pressure?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Tinley Park, IL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The representative was very professional and nice.  She didn't waste your time while talking to you. She made sure she gave me the step-by-step process of after the interview process.
Interview Questions: How many calls a dy did you take at your previous job?

title: Summer Data Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two round interviews and coding sample & writing sample required; one with a director, HR, and the other one with a professor. Got this opportunity through another professor I worked for previously though.
Interview Questions: Past experience mainly; also some questions about data analysis techniques

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: In person interview. I was invited to an in person interview for a research analyst position with Uchicago Medicine. Two doctors, who created a research project, interviewed me for the position.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses for the position?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: the interview process did not take that long the process was rather short and to the point. The questions were not long at all and the time went by fast
Interview Questions: how do you feel about patient care

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Workerd in the cafe doing customer service. checked out staf and visitors. restocked items. opened and closed cafe. always short staffed and no teamwork. wouldnt recommend to anyone now.  good experice with customers and families.
Interview Questions: How do you work with difficult coworkers.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was neutral - HR and then unit managers - behavioral questions were asked and discussed experience level and tasks done since being an RN. Overall, okay experience with the hiring managers at the time.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond

title: Staff Nurse RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a Zoom Interview, with the nurse managers and assistant manager of the floor. Also, afterwards it was a peer interview with nursing staff on the floor.  The interview lasted an hour total.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had a conflict with a coworker. What happened and what was the outcome?

title: Family Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Oak Lawn, IL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Call intake followed by zoom interview meeting with regional physician representative, then Department physician recruitment supervisor. The next step will be to select a couple of the sites I am interested to work in and interview with a local Practicing physician.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in your job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Was asked a few questions about past research experience and what my understanding of the position was. Nothing too intense but was also for a summer position so it's potentially very different for full-time hires.
Interview Questions: What are your past research experiences?

title: Donor Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was quite simple. Questions about my background and how they fit with the job. Received info about the job, start date, next steps, and salary all in initial phone screening
Interview Questions: Do you have any inhospital experience?

title: Nursing Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with various hiring managers. You work with a talent specialist once your application is selected to move on to the interview process. The interview was lengthy since it was a panel. I interviewed alone.
Interview Questions: Please introduce tell us about yourself.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Oct 2020
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weakness?

title: Infusion Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I went through a staffing agency.  The entire process took 2 days. The recruiter sent my information to the manager and the manager contacted me for an interview. I called the next day for a telephone interview.  Very simple and smooth process.
Interview Questions: What is something that you want me to know about you and what is your greatest strength?

title: ED RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, talked with HR, and then had a zoom interview. HR was great. They never turned on their camera, so they could see me, but I could not see them. Interview questions were all similar, and they did not seem interested in hiring me at all, just attacking my resume. Interview was short and uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: How could you handle having multiple critical patients at once, along with non critical patients.

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The job was in a small research center within the hospital. The interview involved two rounds, one with one manager, and a second with a manager and collaborator from the project (both PIs on the research). Very minimal technical questions, more like "have you done this before" more than "prove you can do this". Much more of just a vibe check type interview.
Interview Questions: What kind of work experience do you have?

title: Respiratory Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: As any other interview. Simple and Easy no hard questions or anything complicated. Very nice and straight to the point. I wasn’t nervous or anything throughout the interview and the person on the phone was good
Interview Questions: What’s one thing you could do better for yourslef

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: You have a phone interview with HR, then schedule a date to meet with the hiring manager(s). After the interview, you can wait only God knows how long before you hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position and received an email from a recruiter who then asked me basic questions over the phone. Then she invited me an in person interview with the nurse manager. The interview was about a week after the phone call. I was then interviewed by the nurse manager and then sat with a group of nurses on that unit who told me what it was like and how I planned on handling difficulties they face on the unit. About two weeks after the in person interview with the nurse manager, I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well and was quick. The questions were average job interview questions with a a few scenario questions.  Things did feel a little rushed but I figured maybe they just had a lot going on. I got to meet the other RNs on the unit and ask them questions. No tour. I haven't received an offer yet.
Interview Questions: Can you recall of a time when you noticed a patient's health status was declining? What did you do about it?

title: Trauma Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Quick and efficient. Reference check, phone interview with a recruiter, phone interview with manger, in person interview with Director all within 10 days of application. Very satisfied with overall experience!
Interview Questions: Interview question were mostly related to actually position and education that supports skills to do it.

title: Histotechnologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online, then received an email inviting me to interview. It was straight forward but some information about suggestions for where to park would have been quite helpful.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your closet? If you could have one lab super power, what would it be? The hiring manager who asked these is at a different company, so I'm doubtful these are in the mix anymore.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and three weeks later was called in to come for an interview the next day. The interview was about twenty to thirty minutes long.  Told me he will make a decision after he interview a few more candidates
Interview Questions: What was your biggest accomplishment

title: International Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Three Phone Screens,  then in person interview. 
Personal experience questions in writing, answering questions very specific into the field. 
Then hiring manager requested a powerpoint presentation. 
Not a professional approach, I felt pretty much taken advantage of, as I shared everything I had in my experience only to be completely ignored.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the business in details?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: interviewed by the PI, and top department heads to see if you have an understanding of the job and what is going on in the department. Asked about what you are best at doing and any things you need to improve on
Interview Questions: what are your best attributes to this role?

title: Emergency Department RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I found the position through a job fair, received a tour and interview with the department manager that day. Everyone was extremely nice and encouraging. HR called later that day with an offer.
Interview Questions: Reason for leaving past job, other standard interview questions, nothing unusual

title: Emergency Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Extremely easy, was over the phone. Asked personality and scenario type questions. Let me know if I got hired after a week, did background check and drug test during the 2nd week, passed and got on board immediately. Overall a very smooth process.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you had to resolve a conflict.

title: Patient Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from Human Resources about 2 days after I filled out the application. A couple of days later I went in for an interview. It was pretty basic your regular interview it was kind of dry but pretty easy-going. A couple of days later I was called with a job offer for the position I had interviews for
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Darien, IL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I first filled out the application online and I received a phone interview the next day. The recruiter said if the hiring manager like me my responses then I’ll be invited to a face to face interview. I got the interview and met with the supervisor and manager at the same time.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry caller

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Harvey, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: HR rep will contact you and give some basic information. Then set you up with an in -person interview with the hiring manager. After you meet with the hiring manager the manager will give you a tour of the unit and introduce you to workers on the unit. Then the the HR rep will contact with a off.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and strengths? What would you do if a patient experienced chest pain.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I've been contacted by this hospital multiple times to interview.  After the Intel phone interview, each time they say the hiring interview wants me to interview via phone or in person.  And each time, they never follow through.  And when u attempt to reach out to either the hiring manager or HR, I never get a response back via email or phone.   This wouldn't be so bad if it happened once.  But three separate times in the last six months is ridiculous.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here.

title: Hospitalist Project Research Assistant Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick, 20 minute interview where the interviewer asked very basic questions. I didn't prepare for it and still got the role. She asked questions about previous experience with patients, whether I worked well on my own or required close supervision.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous patient care/customer service experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Harvey, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter about 2 weeks later. Brief phone interview with the recruiter then scheduled an in person interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Generic interview questions. What are your strengths and weaknesses? Why do you want to work here? A question about teamwork. She also asked why I was leaving my current job.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: the manager was very nice and made me feel comfortable. She asked many questions regarding my previous experience. Since I am a new grad, she asked a lot of questions related to my skills and nursing knowledge.
Interview Questions: There were really no difficult questions but the best thing to do is prepare to answer questions by brushing up on your knowledge of skills and to be ready to explain and discuss previous experiences.

title: LPN- Clinic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Was called in to do a written test. After passing that I was called in for two rounds of interviews with the doctors I would be working with. I was surprised that for an LPN position,  I was interviewing as if I was about to land a  post doc fellowship.   I was shocked that after the third time I was called back to interview ,I did not get the position. So don't get too excited if you make it to the 3rd round.  I did and thought I had the job in the bag. WRONG. It was a waste of time.  I was told I wasn't the right fit. YET, it seems almost every few months the clinic (Dermatology) has the same ad for the position. There must be high turnover and low job satisfaction in that department.  I would have loved being in an outpatient clinic. Right now I am in long term care and have been here for YEARS.  Maybe my lack of ambulatory care experience did me in. Unfortunately after trekking to U of C 3 times, I never found out why I wasn't selected.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Private Duty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very detail on your experience and the ability to adapt to different  clients.  The manager was very personable and kind. Immediately told me I would be a good fit for the company
Interview Questions: Do you have ventilator experience with LTV 1100 series

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and a recruiter reached out 2 weeks later. Meet in the hr department, they didn't have me listed to have an interview so the Nurse manager wasn't there when I arrived. Finally meet with the nurse manager.. interview questions were fairly easy. Toured the unit then no offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: Behavioral type questions..

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The phone interviews were about an hour long- one with the HR recruiter and a second with the manager of the unit. The second interview went well, I thought, but I was told later that there were many internal applicants they had to consider first.
Interview Questions:
What quality improvement programs have you helped create/implement? 
Describe a time you had conflict with a peer and how did you handle it?

title: Armed Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Harvey, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process took a while, but the job was mine. The hiring manager described the job and told me what I should expect from the job. He wanted to make sure that all officers have good customer service.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the job?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR though the addresses they provide are completely off , I managed to find where I was supposed to be. The HR department is very nice and helpful. There was some disorder due to construction but otherwise it was a painless process. They validate your parking which is very nice, you can valet or use the parking lot and they still validate for you .
Interview Questions: Describe a character flaw you have ?

title: Pre-Analytical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Very nice interview process, very simple and easy. My interview lasted about 20 minutes and she offered me a choice between two positions. They took me to lunch and we had a discussion once I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you ? what makes you different from others that have applied?

title: Dietetic Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted around forty-five minutes and was located in a conference room on one of the acute care floors. Dietitians from each unit attended and took turns asking questions pertinent to the interview. The lead dietitian explained the company culture and what they expected of me. I was also told I would need to completed modules outside of the work day. Overall everyone was very nice and it ended up being a good experience.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you did not get along with a preceptor?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Quite relaxed, pretty conversational. Went into details in the resume. Some behavioral questions. One on one interview talking about the experiences in-depth. The recruiter would go into details as you describe your experience.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple projects at the same time?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward. Began with a short interview with the HR department followed by an in person interview with the nurse manager. Heard back within a few days in regards to employment. Overall a positive and great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time in which you experienced conflict either with a patient or other coworker.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 7-8 people in department. This seemed so unnecessary for the low pay. I got the feeling that they were looking for someone whose a college grad to stay in the position forever.
Interview Questions: Describe your career goals for the next 5 years

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took about two weeks for the Department I was interviewing with to email me after my application. I met with a manager and a director, who were super professional but hard to read which made the interview uncomfortable. They asked great questions but I caught them (both) laughing at my answers about my past experiences. I can't control the rules of other hospitals. I was very discouraged by this interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations ?

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with the manager of the department. Subsequently, there were separate interviews with sub-groups within the department. The entire process was pretty open-ended, but managed to complete in about 4 hours. The interview included a minimal tour, and extensive description of the work environment and company culture. Questions were a mixture of technical knowledge and assessment of ability to "think on your feet", as well as assessment of "fit". The interview never felt particularly pressured, but the process and questions were thorough and rigorous even so. I was impressed.
Interview Questions: What was the most memorable technical problem you've ever faced?

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Conversational, focused on resume and past experience. Met the team, manager, and several doctors and managers that I would be working with. It was a long day, but the questions were not difficult and the employees were very welcoming.
Interview Questions: Why healthcare? What type of analysis have you done? Do you have any experience with SQL? Tell me about a time you had to analyze and present data and walk me through the process.

title: Position In Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly straightforward. A few phone calls and one half day of interviews for a mid-level leadership position.  They were super nice and responsive until after the interviews and then- boom nothing for 3 months.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the last time you didn't listen to someone.

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first. This was very basic and easy to proceed to the next step. Then in person. This was a one-on-one interview with a manager within the Supply Chain department. Then group.
Interview Questions: Why the University of Chicago Medical Center?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had already volunteered in the lab where I applied, so all of the interviewers already knew me and how I worked. Interview was more of a formality. It was fairly straight forward and in formal. Quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing to work after graduation instead of going straight to graduate school?

title: Employee Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Talent Acquisition Director and Director of Labor Relations. Questions were relevant to experience and described the working environment in this role. UCMC is a complex organization and I appreciated the time spent by the interviewers to explain the relationship between departments and functions.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience in handling difficult employee relations matters

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were no in person interviews. One initial phone interview with a lower level employee. If you passed the first interview, you interviewed over the phone with a director.
Interview Questions: What is your strategy for solving a difficult problem?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy but understandably so, there was some misinformation given to me, but not the fault of the recruiter but of the HR manager.  I put in an application in August of 2014 did not get a call until the middle of October.  I met with 4 people over all, the recruiter, the HR manager, the executive administrator, and the nurse that I was to work with.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for them?

title: Hospitalist Project Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then skype interview with research coordinator and project coordinator. Basic behavioral questions about past experiences and why I was interested in medicine.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you received criticism in the past and how you dealt with that situation?

title: Patient Appointment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Shortly after applying for the position, a recruiter contacted me via email about the position and scheduled me to come in the next day for a face to face interview and to take 5 tests. I passed all of the tests and the interview with recruiter seemed like it went well. The recruiter spoke with me about the position, the salary, the start dates, and the benefits. Also, the recruiter asked me a few basic questions. At the end of the interview the recruiter informed me that someone would contact me for a phone screen and after I pass the phone screen that I would be invited in for another face to face interview. Unfortunately, no one ever contacted me for a phone screen. I followed up with the recruiter but I never got a response which I think was really rude and inconsiderate. I know recruiters interview a lot of people but when someone that you interviews follows up about the position the least they could do is give a reply. The face-to-face interview was very misleading; It's not polite to have a candidate waiting for a phone screen that will never happen.
Interview Questions: It really wasn't unexpected, but they ask about your 5 year plans.

title: Interventional Radiology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interim manager asked me my future plans, if I liked to be involved in unit decisions and projects. Went over job responsibilities. Really she just tried to get to know me to see if my personality and drive were the right fit for the department.
Interview Questions: Do you like to be involved in unit projects and decisions?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted a lab directly for postdoc appointment, so no traditional job posting or going through HR.  Generally same as most postdoc interviews - give a research seminar, talk to lab members, talk to the PI.  Offer was extended at the end of the visit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Psychiatric Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied last year sometime. The recruiter called me to set up an interview and assessment. There were 5 assessments that I had to do. (Office skills, typing, medical terrminology, data entry, & customer service) After the tests, I met with the recruiter for 3 minutes for her to inform me that the director will review my scores and decide if a phone screening will be offered. If I get past the phone screening, then a face to face interview may be offered. After that then there's a offer. Well, I guess the director didn't choose me for a phone interview. I never heard anything from them..... unless that takes another 6 months.
Interview Questions: It really wasn't an interview.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Be yourself, if you're in school be sure to share, be open and express your love for learning about different cultures.  Be honest in answering questions, educate yourself on the hospitals beliefs and emphasize on teamwork, which is huge.
Interview Questions: How I felt about diversity?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact via job fair.  Professional recruitment was very professional & helpful.  The interview process was laborious.  Initially interviewed for one position, which I later learned was not being filled.  I was invited to interview for another position, to which I obliged.  After almost 3 months I was offered a job which I took.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I ever expressed disagreement with superiors.  It was a very unexpected question.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
I was called by the department recruiter to interview for this position. I first had to meet with the recruiter and take an aptitude test which I did really well on. A few days later the recruiter called me and scheduled an in-person interview with the department managers. 

Two people from the department interviewed me at the same time for this position...however, it was far from an interview. The 'interview' lasted an hour and they only asked me one question the entire time. One of the managers told me that she didn't prepare for my interview and had no set questions to ask me. She also reiterated several times throughout the hour that after initial training was over she did not want to be "bothered" during the work day. The rest of the interview time was spent between the two managers gossiping about the department. It was the worst interview experience that I have ever had. The fact that they both did not prepare for this interview really shows how unprofessional that department is.

They said they would get back to me within 2 weeks with a decision; it has been months and I never heard back. Needless to say, I would have declined anyway!
Interview Questions: Tell me about an independent project that you completed.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, then I was brought in two days later for an on site interview. I met the entire lab personnel. I found the interview to be quite pleasant and it lasted about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: One unexpected question was if I was interested in moving to Hyde Park. People commute to the city all of the time for work and play, so I found that quite unexpected.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Did not contact until 23 days later after the filed out the application was submitted for an interview. Interviewed by HR first on one day for 1 hour. Then a peer interview with staff that lasted on a second day for 30 minutes. A third interview with Management that lasted 45 minutes on another day. We toured the hospital.
Interview Questions:
Why here?
Open to work in the ABG lab?
Open to work on the weekends?
Open to work during nites

title: Research Project Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward.  Communication regarding the interview was set up by a project manager.  The project manager gave clear directions on how to get the interview.  The interview alone lasted about half an hour and was handled in a very professional manner.  The position was describe very throughly and the interviewer allowed adequate time for me to ask question.  Any follow up questions that I had was answered relatively quickly.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online (a cold application) and was contacted within a few days of my submission. I had one phone interview with a project manager and, within a week, was called in to have a one-on-one interview. I met with all the members of the research team, including the person whose job I was taking. I was able to speak with her one-on-one was well, in order to get the most candid responses possible. I was called with an offer 3 days after my interview. The entire team was very friendly and welcoming towards me.
Interview Questions: What was my level of comfortability talking about sensitive and personal patient information.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Initial fax in application (2001) now online. recieved call for face to face interview, waited 2.5 weeks while keeping in contact with department manager via leaving messages  ever so often approx every three days. Also went to trade association meeting and met employees of dept.-networking opportunity.Dept. was impressed with membership to trade orginization.
Interview Questions: what was your most difficult situation at work and how did you resolve it?

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I had a hour interview with three supervisors, I was then asked to go to human resources to fill out union card etc...
Orientation was later  I was asked questions about my skills, length of employment, when could I start.
Interview Questions: skills

title: Public Safety Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Three panel interview
Questions of work ethics and integrity 
Situational questions 
Experience In the workplace
You'll meet HR first
If you do well you'll be asked back for second round interviews which is usually with the actual department you'll be working for 
Your third round of interviews will be a panel of three
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Selected from HR to take coding test. They look for a passing rate over 80%. i heard back wthin a week, and was set up to interview with spervisor and manager. The questions were your average interview questions, and quite easy. I had received another offer already, so was not really interested in the position.
Interview Questions: None

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR, set up a phone interview with the dept HR contact, spoke with him, then was invited to campus twice - once to interview with dept Sr. Management, again for a panel interview. All in all it was about 14 hours of interviewing. Quite taxing!
Interview Questions: How would you develop a training program?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UChicago Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Online posts for available positions may be found by looking up the department. Sometimes jobs are posted on search engines such as idealist.com.
Interview Questions: What qualifications set you apart from other applicants?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Extremely unorganized
Interview Questions: This is a horrible place to work...H O R R I B L E!!

title: Quality Assurance Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UChicago Medicine in Apr 2007
Interview Descriptions: I posted my resume to the internal HR site, applied for the position, and was contacted by their HR person a couple days later.  After speaking with HR and confirming qualifications and expectations (previous duties and current salary and anticipated salary), my information was forwarded to the department head.  The head contacted me via telephone for a "fit" test and i was asked to come in person to the company to meet with colleagues and supervisors I would directly work with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current employer?
